title: Cross-Training and Feedback-Integrated CBVLE-Based Microlearning for Nursing Dosage Calculations

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Context-specific medication simulation and cross-training via mobile apps in digitally equipped environments.

learning_goals: Learners enhance their ability to calculate accurate medication dosages by applying various dosing scenarios in a CBVLE (Computer-Based Virtual Learning Environment).

Learners identify at least three similar error patterns (e.g., sign errors, calculation omissions, unit conversion errors) through interleaved practice and explain problem-solving processes incorporating corrective feedback with over 80% accuracy.

Learners can solve a total of 10 problems—including 5 unit conversion tasks (e.g., kg→g, mg→mcg) and 3 patient-weight-consideration tasks (dose calculation per weight)—in medical problem scenarios (e.g., medication dosage calculation) with 80% accuracy through step-by-step verification (unit confirmation → formula application → result review).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
